VendorName: AmeriHealth Caritas District of Columbia, Inc.
AdditionalInformation:
The attached proposed contract extension with AmeriHealth Caritas District of Columbia, Inc. in the not-to-exceed amount of $89,177,251.00 to provide healthcare and pharmacy services for its Managed Care Program, consisting of: its Medicaid eligible population enrolled in the District Healthy Families Program (DCHFP) and the District Healthcare Alliance Program (Alliance) and Immigrant Children's Program (ICP) was filed in the Office of the Secretary on March 19, 2017.   

The Council's ten day review begins Wednesday, March 20, 2019, including Saturdays, Sundays, Council recess and legal holidays. The proposed contract will be deemed approved on Saturday, March 30, 2019, unless a resolution of approval or disapproval is introduced within the ten day review period, extending the review to 45 days.
ShortTitle: Proposed contract extension with AmeriHealth Caritas District of Columbia, Inc.

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it exempts 2714 Georgia Avenue, N.W. from taxation and to provide equitable tax relief.
ShortTitle: Mypheduh Films DBA Sankofa Video and Books Real Property Tax Exemption Act of 2019
RereferralCommittee: Committee on Business and Economic Development

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it provides for a real property tax exemption for DC Pancakes, LLC, located at 3100 14th Street, N.W.
ShortTitle: 14th Street International House of Pancakes Real Property Tax Exemption Act of 2019
RereferralCommittee: Committee on Business and Economic Development

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it provides real property tax relief to certain property owned by Washington Parks & People.
ShortTitle: Washington Parks & People Equitable Real Property Tax Relief Act of 2019
RereferralCommittee: Committee on Business and Economic Development

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it adds the Deanwood Town Center to a list of locations eligible for a tax exemption pursuant to the construction of certain eligible businesses.
Introducer: Councilmembers Gray, Cheh, McDuffie, Evans, R. White, T. White, and Bonds
ShortTitle: Supermarket Tax Incentives Eligible Area Amendment Act of 2019
RereferralCommittee: Committee on Business and Economic Development

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it abates the imposition of taxes on real property known as Park 7 at Minnesota-Benning.
ShortTitle: Park 7 at Minnesota-Benning Tax Abatement Act of 2019
RereferralCommittee: Committee on Business and Economic Development

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it extends the deadline to terminate the Bryant Street Tax increment Financing Area from March 1, 2019 to March 1, 2020.
ShortTitle: Bryant Street Tax Increment Financing Amendment Act of 2019
RereferralCommittee: Committee on Business and Economic Development

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it provides real property tax relief to property located at 3825 South Capitol Street, S.W., and 546 Newcomb Street, S.E.
ShortTitle: Unfoldment, Inc. Real Property Tax Relief Act of 2019
RereferralCommittee: Committee on Business and Economic Development

Randall School Museum and Housing Development Real Property Tax Abatement Act of 2019
RereferralCommittee: Committee on Business and Economic Development

CommitteeReferral: Committee on Education and Committee of the Whole
ShortTitle: Sense of the Council on School Dress Code and Uniform Polices that Promote Equity, Nondiscrimination, and Respect for Cultural Diversity Resolution of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it requires health care facilities to add community benefits as a requirement for obtaining or maintaining a certificate of need. Health care facilities would also be required to direct the community benefits to District residents, as a condition of holding or receiving a certificate of need.
ShortTitle: Community Health Investment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it establishes mandatory reporting of suspected instances of financial exploitation of seniors and vulnerable adults applicable to banks, credit unions, and other depository and non-depository institutions, insurers, broker dealers and investment advisors.  Among other things it makes regulated entities eligible for immunity from civil and administrative liability for reporting, disclosure, and disbursement delays.
CommitteeReferralComments: Committee on Housing and Neighborhood Revitalization
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Business and Economic Development
ShortTitle: Protection of Seniors and Vulnerable Adults from Financial Exploitation Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it enhances the ability of the Department of Insurance, Securities and Banking to protect consumers by licensing and regulating business entities that are not currently regulated.  It adds several new licensing categories and regulatory requirements to non-depository financial institutions, including currency exchangers, debt collectors and retail sellers.
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Business and Economic Development
ShortTitle: Financial Services Consumer Protection Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it prohibits the use of credit history or lack thereof, in decisions by insurers about whether to underwrite a policy, cancel a policy, refuse to renew a policy, or increase the premium for a renewal policy.
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Business and Economic Development
ShortTitle: Restrictions on the Use of Credit Information Amendment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it exempts certain nonprofits providing vision screenings to children and youth from the certificate of need process.
CommitteeReferralComments: Committee on Education and Committee of the Whole
Introducer: Councilmembers T. White, Grosso, Nadeau, Cheh, and Chairman Mendelson
ShortTitle: Children and Youth Vision Screening Amendment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it expands the definition of an eligible felony with regards to sealing records and makes all misdemeanors eligible for sealing.
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Judiciary and Public Safety
ShortTitle: Criminal Record Expungement Amendment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it establishes when a petitioner including an intimate partner, family member, household member, victim of sexual abuse, a minor or a minor's parent, guardian or custodian, may file a petition for civil protection in the Domestic Violence Unit. It creates anti-stalking orders. Among other things, it allows the court to extend temporary protection orders incrementally and establishes a dedicated unit in the MPD to serve process in civil protection order cases.
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Judiciary and Public Safety
Introducer: Councilmembers Allen, Cheh, Grosso, Todd, Bonds, Evans, Nadeau, and Chairman Mendelson
ShortTitle: Intrafamily Offenses and Anti-Stalking Orders Amendment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it establishes an On-Site Services Program to provide funding to qualifying housing providers. The on-site services include mental health services, food and nutrition services, childcare services and after-school programs among other things.
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Human Services and Committee on Housing and Neighborhood Revitalization
Introducer: Councilmembers Nadeau, McDuffie, R. White, Cheh, T. White, Silverman, Grosso, and Bonds
ShortTitle: On-Site Services Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it authorizes the Office of Human Rights to impose civil financial penalties on property owners who advertise their intent to discriminate against rental applicants using housing vouchers.
CommitteeReferralComments: Committee on Housing and Neighborhood Revitalization
Introducer: Councilmembers Silverman, Nadeau, Allen, Grosso, Evans, and Bonds
ShortTitle: Housing Voucher Discrimination Penalty Amendment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it creates an Interagency Council on Behavioral Health and describes its members, powers, and duties.
Introducer: Councilmembers Grosso, Silverman, Nadeau, McDuffie, and Todd
ShortTitle: Interagency Council on Behavioral Health Establishment Amendment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it requires that every residential unit in a new residential building be individually metered for each electric, natural gas, and water utility service received by the unit.
CommitteeReferralComments: Committee on Housing and Neighborhood Revitalization
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Business and Economic Development
Introducer: Councilmembers Bonds, Grosso, Allen, and Todd
ShortTitle: Green Building Residential Metering Amendment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it requires children less than 5 years of age in the care of a child development facility to wear a United States Coast Guard-approved personal flotation device when within 50 feet of an unsecured water facility, at least one or more feet in depth.  A violation will result in up to $750 in fines or a suspended license.
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Education and Committee of the Whole
ShortTitle: Child Water Safety Amendment Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it establishes the Elder Abuse Response Team ("EART") as a commission of the Office of the Attorney General. Members include representatives from the Office on Aging, the Department of Insurance, Securities, and Banking, the offices of the DC and US Attorney General, MPD and the District Office for Victim Services and Justice Grants or their designee.
CommitteeReferralComments: Committee on Human Services and Committee on Housing and Neighborhood Revitalization
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Judiciary and Public Safety
Introducer: Councilmembers Bonds, Todd, Gray, Grosso, and R. White
ShortTitle: Elder Abuse Response Team Act of 2019

AdditionalInformation: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced it establishes the Small Business Bonding Program to provide training, financial, and technical assistance to eligible participants.  It also requires annual reporting that evaluates the program's performance.
CommitteeReferral: Committee on Business and Economic Development
Introducer: Councilmembers McDuffie, Allen, T. White, R. White, Cheh, Todd, Grosso, Evans, Bonds, Nadeau, Gray, and Chairman Mendelson
ShortTitle: Small Business Bonding Program Establishment Amendment Act of 2019
